trans-unit.source: Publish machine learning web service to Azure Marketplace | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Publish machine learning web service to Azure Marketplace | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to publish your Azure Machine Learning Web Service to the Azure Marketplace
trans-unit.target: How to publish your Azure Machine Learning Web Service to the Azure Marketplace

trans-unit.source: The Azure Marketplace provides the ability to publish Azure Machine Learning web services as paid or free services for consumption by external customers.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Marketplace provides the ability to publish Azure Machine Learning web services as paid or free services for consumption by external customers.

trans-unit.source: This article provides an overview of that process with links to guidelines to get you started.
trans-unit.target: This article provides an overview of that process with links to guidelines to get you started.

trans-unit.source: By using this process, you can make your web services available for other developers to consume in their applications.
trans-unit.target: By using this process, you can make your web services available for other developers to consume in their applications.

trans-unit.source: The following are the steps for publishing an Azure Machine Learning web service to Azure Marketplace:
trans-unit.target: The following are the steps for publishing an Azure Machine Learning web service to Azure Marketplace:

trans-unit.source: Create and publish a Machine Learning Request-Response service (RRS)
trans-unit.target: Create and publish a Machine Learning Request-Response service (RRS)

trans-unit.source: Deploy the service to production, and obtain the API Key and OData endpoint information.
trans-unit.target: Deploy the service to production, and obtain the API Key and OData endpoint information.

trans-unit.source: Use the URL of the published web service to publish to <linkText>Azure Marketplace (Data Market)</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: Use the URL of the published web service to publish to <linkText>Azure Marketplace (Data Market)</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Once submitted, your offer is reviewed and needs to be approved before your customers can start purchasing it.
trans-unit.target: Once submitted, your offer is reviewed and needs to be approved before your customers can start purchasing it.

trans-unit.source: The publishing process can take a few business days.
trans-unit.target: The publishing process can take a few business days.

trans-unit.source: If you have not done this already, please take a look at this <linkText>walk through</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you have not done this already, please take a look at this <linkText>walk through</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: From the Azure management portal, select the MACHINE LEARNING option from the left navigation bar, and select your workspace.
trans-unit.target: From the Azure management portal, select the MACHINE LEARNING option from the left navigation bar, and select your workspace.

trans-unit.source: Click on the WEB SERVICES tab, and select the web service you would like to publish to the marketplace.
trans-unit.target: Click on the WEB SERVICES tab, and select the web service you would like to publish to the marketplace.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Marketplace</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Marketplace</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the endpoint you would like to have the marketplace consume.
trans-unit.target: Select the endpoint you would like to have the marketplace consume.

trans-unit.source: If you have not created any additional endpoints, you can select the Default endpoint.
trans-unit.target: If you have not created any additional endpoints, you can select the Default endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Once you have clicked on the endpoint, you will be able to see the API KEY.
trans-unit.target: Once you have clicked on the endpoint, you will be able to see the API KEY.

trans-unit.source: You will need this piece of information later on in Step 3, so make a copy of it.
trans-unit.target: You will need this piece of information later on in Step 3, so make a copy of it.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Marketplace</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Marketplace</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click on the REQUEST/RESPONSE method, at this point we do not support publishing batch execution services to the marketplace.
trans-unit.target: Click on the REQUEST/RESPONSE method, at this point we do not support publishing batch execution services to the marketplace.

trans-unit.source: That will take you to the API help page for the Request/Response method.
trans-unit.target: That will take you to the API help page for the Request/Response method.

trans-unit.source: Copy the OData Endpoint Address, you will need this information later on in Step 3.
trans-unit.target: Copy the OData Endpoint Address, you will need this information later on in Step 3.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Marketplace</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Marketplace</linkText>

trans-unit.source: deploy the service into production.
trans-unit.target: deploy the service into production.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to <linkText>Azure Marketplace (Data Market)</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: Navigate to <linkText>Azure Marketplace (Data Market)</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Click on the Publish link at the top of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click on the Publish link at the top of the page.

trans-unit.source: This will take you to the <linkText>Microsoft Azure Publishing Portal</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: This will take you to the <linkText>Microsoft Azure Publishing Portal</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Click on the publishers section to register as a publisher.
trans-unit.target: Click on the publishers section to register as a publisher.

trans-unit.source: When creating a new offer, select Data Services, then click Create a New Data Service.
trans-unit.target: When creating a new offer, select Data Services, then click Create a New Data Service.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Marketplace</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Marketplace</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Under Plans provide information on your offering, including a pricing plan.
trans-unit.target: Under Plans provide information on your offering, including a pricing plan.

trans-unit.source: Decide if you will offer a free or paid service.
trans-unit.target: Decide if you will offer a free or paid service.

trans-unit.source: To get paid, provide payment information such as your bank and tax information.
trans-unit.target: To get paid, provide payment information such as your bank and tax information.

trans-unit.source: Under Marketing provide information about your offer, such as the title and description for your offer.
trans-unit.target: Under Marketing provide information about your offer, such as the title and description for your offer.

trans-unit.source: Under Pricing you can set the price for your plans for specific countries, or let the system "autoprice" your offer.
trans-unit.target: Under Pricing you can set the price for your plans for specific countries, or let the system "autoprice" your offer.

trans-unit.source: On the Data Service tab, click Web Service as the Data Source.
trans-unit.target: On the Data Service tab, click Web Service as the Data Source.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Marketplace</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Marketplace</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Get the web service URL and API key from the Azure management portal, as explained in step 2 above.
trans-unit.target: Get the web service URL and API key from the Azure management portal, as explained in step 2 above.

trans-unit.source: In the Marketplace Data Service setup dialog box, paste the OData endpoint address into the Service URL text box.
trans-unit.target: In the Marketplace Data Service setup dialog box, paste the OData endpoint address into the Service URL text box.

trans-unit.source: For Authentication, choose Header as the Authentication Scheme.
trans-unit.target: For Authentication, choose Header as the Authentication Scheme.

trans-unit.source: Enter "Authorization" for the Header Name.
trans-unit.target: Enter "Authorization" for the Header Name.

trans-unit.source: For the Header Value, enter "Bearer" (without the quotation marks), click the Space bar, and then paste the API key.
trans-unit.target: For the Header Value, enter "Bearer" (without the quotation marks), click the Space bar, and then paste the API key.

trans-unit.source: Select the This Service is OData check box.
trans-unit.target: Select the This Service is OData check box.

trans-unit.source: Click Test Connection to test the connection.
trans-unit.target: Click Test Connection to test the connection.

trans-unit.source: Under Categories, ensure Machine Learning is selected.
trans-unit.target: Under Categories, ensure Machine Learning is selected.

trans-unit.source: When you are done entering all the metadata about your offer, click on Publish, and then Push to Staging.
trans-unit.target: When you are done entering all the metadata about your offer, click on Publish, and then Push to Staging.

trans-unit.source: At this point, you will be notified of any remaining issues that you need to fix.
trans-unit.target: At this point, you will be notified of any remaining issues that you need to fix.

trans-unit.source: After you have ensured completion of all the outstanding issues, click on Request approval to push to Production.
trans-unit.target: After you have ensured completion of all the outstanding issues, click on Request approval to push to Production.

trans-unit.source: The publishing process can take a few business days.
trans-unit.target: The publishing process can take a few business days.
